definition[0]: disagreement, angry feelings, or unfriendliness between people
example[0]: Having my mother living with us causes friction at home.
example[1]: the usual frictions between parents and their teenage children
example[2]: His independent attitude was a constant source of friction with his boss.
definition[1]: the natural force that prevents one surface from sliding easily over another surface
example[3]: Putting oil on both surfaces reduces friction.
definition[2]: when one surface rubs against another
example[4]: Check your rope frequently, as friction against the rock can wear it away.
